messages.subject: Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/2003 1:32:37 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Oh, oh...ooh, ooh ,OOH!!!! I positively ADORE the Cadfael series. I rent them from the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/2003 1:32:37 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
> So, I'm always looking for more movie recommendations. What have you
> all enjoyed recently? Recently my son decided that he liked the Cadfael
> episode that I was watching. (And the little voice says "Yay!
> Historical! and Herbal, too!)

Oh, oh...ooh, ooh ,OOH!!!!
I positively ADORE the Cadfael series. I rent them from the library all the
time. I even bought the herb book based on the series "Brother Cadfael's Herb
Garden"...gorgeous pictures and great info.
Fabulous for those interested in medieval times.

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! Thanks for all the answers to my questions. I guess I wasn t really understanding the essence of unschooling. Rachel __________________________________ Do
messages.messageBody:
Hi!
Thanks for all the answers to my questions. I guess I
wasn't really understanding the essence of
unschooling.

Rachel

messages.subject: Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/21/02 8:36:23 AM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/21/02 8:36:23 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Life's a journey. Live for
today: if you're constantly thinking about what your children will be when
they're GROWN, you'll MISS who they ARE, NOW.
>>

Yes, yes, yes!!! That is exactly it.
Ren
